intro: Onosma gigantea, commonly known as the giant onosma, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stem and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate to cold climates. Its leaves are often hairy and have a distinctive, aromatic scent. Onosma gigantea is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
